Description: Chian pottery plastic head from a probably black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel, possibly a lekane; white slip; exterior: female head with painted facial features and dotted necklace; part of vertical maeander pattern on either side; below, dividing band of billets between brown lines; inside reserved; above, slipped area, seemingly part of a floor.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ1 ('bothros' / 'trench with bowls'), AΠ190 or AP20 from the bottom of the sand in the temenos
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Lemos no. 1438 from Phana, upon which numerous plastic heads appear on the handle of a bell-shaped vase. The Sphinx and Lion Style is very clear on the body of the vase. The pencilled registration number A995.2 is from Smith's unpublished catalogue. For a discussion on plastic heads, see Lemos 1991, 140.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1380, pl. 177)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2066) (phase 2)
